page.title: 03Schools and Education
page.content: Sited within the survey block are five schools. Iwade and Bobbing are both state primary schools for children of 5 to 11 years. Middletune junior takes children of 7 to 11 years from the Milton area. Also in the Milton area are St Thomas' and St Bartholemews for children with learning difficulties the former is for educationally sub normal (ESN) and the latter for those with severe physical handicaps, both schools take children from a wide area. Bobbing is small with only 30 children and although thought to close it has just had new toilets and scullery provided. Iwade is larger with 120 pupils and a mixture of old and new buildings with some toilets still outside. Middletune has modern purpose built facilities. After 11 most pupils transfer to Sittingbourne schools, usually Westlands.
